Package toystore.parser

Class ParserCSV

java.lang.Object
toystore.parser.ParserCSV
public class ParserCSV
extends java.lang.Object
Includes 2 public methods for writing and reading to/from a csv file, storing the csv as a List of lists of String objects. The parser uses information from FieldsOfInterest for sorting the fields so that it respects the order in the enum, removing all fields which headers are not in the enumeration. The class has 2 exceptions associated to it: CsvReadingException and CsvWritingException used as unchecked wrapper exception, so that we don't have to propagate multiple checked exceptions throughout the whole package, they are easy to read by end-users.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static int PRICE_ORDINAL
    This is a constant of the class, used in many methods, it is defined as the ordinal of price in FieldsOfInterest

    Remove all columns that are not a member of FieldsOfInterest enum, to make a field visible in the in final list, add a new entry in the specified enum

      public ParserCSV()

  • Method Details

    • readCSV

      public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> readCSV​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Opens the file with name of the parameter and parses it into a usable format, keeping only the information that we want from the file. Fields that are being kept are listed in the enum FieldsOfInterest.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the csv file
      Returns:
      List of lines of csv file (a line is a List of Strings)
      Throws:
      CsvReadingException - If any errors appear while reading to the csv file

    • csvToList

      private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> csvToList​(java.io.Reader reader) throws java.io.IOException
      Parse a stream input that has csv format into a matrix, represented into a List of lists of strings, strings being fields of csv file. For every line read, keep the id in a hashmap, if the new uniq_id is already in the map, skip this line because we have already read this object.
      Parameters:
      reader - Stream for reading the csv file
      Returns:
      A list of columns, each column being a list of strings, list of a certain field of a csv file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Error while reading

    • removeCommaFromPrice

      private void removeCommaFromPrice​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> line)
      Remove commas from the price field so that the parsing will not throw NumberFormatException
      Parameters:
      line - line of csv file

    • replaceEmptyWithZero

      private void replaceEmptyWithZero​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> line)
      Replace empty String in field that holds number_available_in_stock with 0 new
      Parameters:
      line - line of csv file with a product characteristics

    • deleteAfterWhiteSpace

      private void deleteAfterWhiteSpace​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> line)
      For prices that don't respect the format symbol + value, delete the surplus of characters after a space or non-breaking space (in the field for price)
      Parameters:
      line - line of csv file with a product characteristics

    • addNotAvailableToManufacturer

      private void addNotAvailableToManufacturer​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> line)
      For products that do not have a manufacturer specified write Not Available in that place.
      Parameters:
      line - line of csv file with a product characteristics

    • parseNumberInStock

      private void parseNumberInStock​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> numberInStock)
      Removes the trailing "new" string after the number of new products, or whatever string is appended to the to the word. The only condition is that the number of new products is the first one in the line and separated by either a space or a non-breaking space from the rest of the words.
      Parameters:
      numberInStock - column with all of the numbers of new products

    • removeHeaderOfCsv

      private void removeHeaderOfCsv​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> listCsv)
      If first line of csv list has header format, delete it format checking is matching first element with values of FieldsOfInterest enum
      Parameters:
      listCsv - list of lists of csv values

    • keepOnlyRequestedColumns

      private void keepOnlyRequestedColumns​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> list)
      Remove all columns that are not a member of FieldsOfInterest enum, to make a field visible in the in final list, add a new entry in the specified enum
      Parameters:
      list - List of columns (which are lists of strings)

    • rearrangeInOrder

      private void rearrangeInOrder​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> list)
      Swaps the columns around so that the order of them respect the order of enum items in the FieldsOfInterest enumeration. To get the columns in a specific order modify the order of entries in the enum linked above. First enumeration value will represent the first column of the matrix
      Parameters:
      list - list of columns

    • writeCSV

      public void writeCSV​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> listCSV, java.lang.String fileName)
      Writes the formatted list to a csv file, with a default header, with the specific order of FieldsOfInterest enumeration, separated by commas
      Parameters:
      listCSV - list of lists of fields for a csv file
      fileName - name of csv file we writing to
      Throws:
      CsvWritingException - If any errors appear while writing to the csv file

    • transposeLinesAndColumns

      private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> transposeLinesAndColumns​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> initial)
      Considering the input a matrix, this function transposes the matrix. In other words if the input is a list of columns, the function returns a list of lines; and for a list of lines, it returns a list of columns
      Parameters:
      initial - List of lists of strings in a matrix format, either a list of lines, or a list of columns
      Returns:
      List of lists of strings in a matrix format
